Articles.Content:
Have you heard of the Munhole? Probably not. It's pretty amazing. Observe!

THIS is the Munhole. It is a multi-kilometer deep HOLE. That's all there is to it. There have been other projects that use the Munhole, such as the Hanging Gardens of Mun, but I'd like to make this massive hole (shut up) more known.

Operation Munhole is an effort to create a large versatile base that can have multiple purposes. As of now, the base consists of three modules: the hab module, the generator tower and the skycrane. Using KAS, I can easily attach these modules and create a large, non-dense base. For heavy lifting purposes, we have a skycrane equipped with a winch (farthest to the right). For living quarters and whatever Kerbals do just sitting there, there is the Habitation Module, or Hab Module for short (far left). And finally (for the moment) there is the generator station (middle), or as I like to call it, the TOWER OF POWER. The Tower of Power, or TOP for short, supplies solar and RTG power for all of the other modules in the base.

Planned additions include:

- A mobile Kethane mining ship, as there is no Kethane present in the Munhole area as far as I know, but there is a deposit roughly 3-7 km away from it.

- A bulky Kethane conversion module.

- An escape module.

- A rover or two.

- A rover hangar.

THIS PROJECT IS OPEN TO YOU! Your ideas matter, and I am always willing to take them and maybe I'll add them. Cheers to all!
What coordinates is this hole located at?
Build different stuff on different layers! You could make a surface spaceport, a hanging hab module and a bottom-of-the-mun hole miner base!

What coordinates is this hole located at?

57*39'34"N 9*05'00"E

Don't try to directly land mechjeb there though, it dosen't like steep slopes like in the munhole. It will try to land on these 85 degree things!

If you're wondering "Why?" then there are a couple reasons to go to the Munhole. First off, landing (which I will do once I fly all the components there) is quite hard (and fun) in the munhole, as the slightest horizontal translation could be the end of you. Also, the main reason I wanted to go there originally is because I have a sort of challenge for myself to put a bridge across the thing. That would be awesome. I just think it's sort of a fun place to try things at.
Very interesting. I might fly a probe or a rover there to explore some time.
OP, why do you think we've never heard of it? Isn't that kind of derogatory towards thousands of people who did a ton of work in KSP?

OP, why do you think we've never heard of it? Isn't that kind of derogatory towards thousands of people who did a ton of work in KSP?

Ah, it was certainly not intended to be that way. Sorry to all who thought that! Um, the reason I said it is because first of all, it is impossible to spot from more than roughly 15 km away, as the game often does not render fine terrain details like that from afar. Second of all, it is not a very well known feature! Googling "munhole" gives little to no results. I didn't want that to be degrading to others, I just wanted more people to be aware of the Munhole's existence than there is now. Not many people know about the Munhole, so I included that in the hook of my post.

MONOLITH SEEKERS: I have found that there is a monolith UNDER the Munhole! Look just below the base of the hole, on the bit of rendered terrain, and you will see a small black rectangle!

An added bonus to going there!
